description: Savor the rich, creamy flavors of butter chicken made right in your kitchen! This easy recipe is perfect for meal prep and pairs beautifully with naan or rice.
ingredients: 1 pound chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.

Stir in chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides.

structured_content.content: This Quick & Easy Homemade Butter Chicken is a delightful dish that brings the rich, creamy flavors of Indian cuisine right to your table. Perfect for busy weeknights, it offers a comforting meal that the whole family will love.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 45 minutes
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for weeknight dinners or meal prep
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Comforting and satisfying for any occasion

structured_content.content: I remember the first time I made butter chicken for my family; the aroma filled the kitchen, and everyone gathered around the table, eager to dig in. It quickly became a favorite!

• Main ingredient: Chicken works best for its tender texture and ability to absorb flavors.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Garam masala and cumin are essential for that authentic taste.
  • Supporting ingredients: Heavy cream adds richness, while tomato sauce provides a tangy base.
  • Equipment needed: A large skillet is essential for even cooking and flavor development.

upload.context: A vibrant display of fresh ingredients for butter chicken preparation, showcasing the key components.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Start by chopping the onion, garlic, and ginger. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces for quick cooking.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Follow the instructions carefully, ensuring the chicken is browned and the sauce is well combined for maximum flavor.
Finishing Touches:
Garnish with fresh cilantro to add a pop of color and freshness to the dish.

upload.context: Capturing the cooking process of butter chicken, highlighting the vibrant colors and textures.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Cook the chicken until it's fully cooked through to avoid any food safety issues.
  • Avoid overcooking the sauce to maintain its creamy texture.
  • Look for a rich, deep color in the sauce to indicate it's ready.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container for up to 3 days; reheat gently.

structured_content.content: This dish is perfect for sharing with loved ones, creating memories around the dinner table that last a lifetime.
Consider adding a pinch of chili powder for heat or a squeeze of lemon for brightness. Fresh herbs like mint can also elevate the dish.
Serve with warm naan, fluffy basmati rice, or a crisp salad for a complete meal. Pair with a refreshing yogurt drink for balance.
For a lighter version, substitute chicken with chickpeas or tofu for a vegetarian twist. You can also use coconut milk instead of heavy cream for a dairy-free option.

upload.context: A beautifully plated butter chicken dish, garnished with cilantro and served with naan.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Marinate chicken for at least 30 minutes for deeper flavor.
  • Use fresh spices for the best aroma and taste.
  • Keep an eye on the sauce to prevent it from thickening too much.
  • Serve in a warm bowl for an inviting presentation.

structured_content.content: Don't hesitate to try this recipe! The joy of creating a delicious butter chicken will inspire you to cook more and share with others.
